snippet: The materials, called thermosets, are unusually strong and light, exhibit “self-healing” properties and can be easily reformed to make products recyclable.
abstract: Report in journal Science by IBM research team details accidental discovery of new family of materials that are unusually strong and light, exhibit self-healing properties and can be easily reformed to make products recyclable; materials, which are types of synthetic polymers, could have transportation uses and could have an impact on consumer products and industrial packaging.
lead_paragraph: The materials, called thermosets, are unusually strong and light, exhibit “self-healing” properties and can be easily reformed to make products recyclable.

headline.main: Error at IBM Lab Finds New Family of Materials
headline.print_headline: Error at IBM Lab Finds New Family of Materials
